snippet: A Special Operations team failed to rescue the journalist James Foley and other Americans held in Syria during a secret mission earlier this summer.
abstract: Obama administration officials reveal that United States military had conducted secret mission in Syria to rescue American journalist James Foley and other hostages being held by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants; American commandos fought their way to where they believed ISIS was hiding hostages, but found that the captives had been moved.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Edgartown, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A Special Operations team failed to rescue the journalist James Foley and other Americans held in Syria during a secret mission earlier this summer.

headline.main: In Raid to Save Foley and Other Hostages, U.S. Found None
headline.print_headline: In a U.S. Raid, Forces Found No Hostages

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
